Class PLST

java.lang.Object
schedulingAlgorithm.PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.implementation.PLST
public class PLST extends PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
Partitioned implementation of the LST scheduler.

Represents a partitioned scheduling algorithm that assigns an independent local LST (Least Slack Time) scheduler to each core. This integrates the original class note "Partitioned LST." and clarifies the class responsibility within the schedulingAlgorithm.implementation package.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • PLST

      public PLST()
      Constructs a new PLST instance.

      Initializes the algorithm display name to "Partitioned LST", preserving the original constructor intent to identify this partitioned scheduling strategy.

  • Method Details

    • setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm

      public void setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm(Vector<Core> cores)
      Assigns the LST local scheduling algorithm to each core.

      Iterates over the provided cores vector and sets each core's local scheduler to a new LST instance by invoking c.setLocalSchedAlgorithm(new LST()). Under this partitioned strategy, every core operates with its own LST scheduler.

      Specified by:
      setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm in class PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      cores - a Vector of Core objects whose local scheduling algorithm will be set; must not be null. Each element receives a new LST instance.
